description: This Python source file contains helper functions for configuring OAuth 2.0 authentication flows for Atlassian products like Jira and Confluence. It retrieves configuration data primarily from environment variables, including URLs, client IDs, client secrets, and redirect URIs, with fallback mechanisms for flexible configuration.

methods.name: str _env_first(*names: str, default: str = "")
methods.description: Retrieves the first non-empty environment variable value among provided names, with an optional default.

methods.name: str get_atlassian_base_url()
methods.description: Returns the base URL for Atlassian Cloud, obtained from environment variables.

methods.name: Dict[str,str] get_jira_oauth_config()
methods.description: Constructs and returns a dictionary with Jira OAuth configuration parameters from environment variables, including client ID, secret, redirect URI, and base URL.

methods.name: Dict[str,str] get_confluence_oauth_config()
methods.description: Constructs and returns Confluence OAuth configuration, falling back to Jira or general Atlassian values if dedicated Confluence environment variables aren't set.

methods.name: str get_frontend_base_url_default()
methods.description: Returns the default frontend URL for redirecting after authentication, based on environment variables.
